meanings.definition: Feel or express contempt or derision for.
meanings.sent2: He scorned the idea of cheating.
meanings.sent3: The cat scorned the toy mouse, preferring a real one instead.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scorned his attempts at flattery.
meanings.sent5: The teacher scorned the student's lazy excuses.

meanings.definition: Reject or dismiss as unworthy or beneath consideration.
meanings.sent1: He scorned the job offer, believing he deserved better.
meanings.sent2: She scorned his apology, feeling it was insincere.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater scorned the vegetables on his plate.
meanings.sent4: The artist scorned traditional techniques, opting for a more modern approach.
meanings.sent5: The team scorned defeat, vowing to come back stronger next time.
